cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles W of Port Charlotte, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi/Alabama border)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near southeast Louisiana or coastal Mississippi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm surge, tropical-storm and hurricane watches/warnings confined to the north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings Grand Isle LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Pontchartrain; tropical-storm warning east of Ocean Springs to Indian Pass FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and eastern Gulf Coast from the Florida Panhandle westward to southeast Louisiana; no direct impact expected along Georgia’s Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤3 %) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional breezy conditions possible
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant tropical-cyclone-related rainfall anticipated at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rip currents along the southeast U.S. Atlantic beaches may increase, but direct port operations are not expected to be affected
